name: REST API - EXAMPLE
description: This flow showcases how to use the REST API Connector component to make REST API requests. It demonstrates configuring URLs, setting HTTP methods, adding custom headers, and including query parameters to fetch data from an API. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
import json
from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional
from urllib.parse import parse_qsl, urlencode, urlparse, urlunparse

import requests
from loguru import logger
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, DropdownInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, NestedDictInput, Output, SecretStrInput, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.dotdict import dotdict

class RESTAPIConnector(Component):
    display_name = "REST API Connector"
    description = (
        "This component enables making advanced REST API requests to one or more URLs. "
        "You can configure headers, body, and query parameters dynamically and externally, as well as manage "
        "timeouts and choose from various HTTP methods. Additionally, you can parse a cURL command "
        "to auto-fill these fields."
    )
    icon = "Globe"
    name = "RESTAPIConnector"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="urls",
            display_name="URLs",
            is_list=True,
            info="Enter one or more URLs, separated by commas.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="method",
            display_name="HTTP Method",
            options=["GET", "POST", "PUT", "PATCH", "DELETE"],
            value="GET",
            info="Select the HTTP method for the request.",
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="timeout",
            display_name="Timeout (seconds)",
            value=5,
            info="Specify the timeout duration for the request.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="API Key",
            value="None",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="auth_type",
            display_name="Authentication Type",
            options=["None", "Basic", "Bearer"],
            value="None",
            advanced=True,
            info="Choose the type of authentication for the request.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="username",
            display_name="Username (for Basic Auth)",
            advanced=True,
            value="",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="password",
            display_name="Password (for Basic Auth)",
            advanced=True,
            value="None",
        ),
        NestedDictInput(
            name="headers",
            display_name="Custom Headers",
            info="Headers to include with the request.",
            input_types=["Data"],
            advanced=True,
        ),
        NestedDictInput(
            name="body",
            display_name="Body Parameters",
            info="Body parameters for POST, PUT, PATCH requests.",
            input_types=["Data"],
            advanced=True,
        ),
        NestedDictInput(
            name="query_params",
            display_name="Query Parameters",
            info="Query parameters to append to the URL.",
            input_types=["Data"],
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="curl",
            display_name="cURL Command",
            info="Paste a cURL command to auto-fill fields.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Response Data", name="data", method="make_requests"),
    ]

    def parse_curl(self, curl: str, build_config: dotdict) -> dotdict:
        try:
            # Parse cURL command into components
            parsed = parse_context(curl)
            build_config["urls"]["value"] = [parsed.url]
            build_config["method"]["value"] = parsed.method.upper()
            build_config["headers"]["value"] = dict(parsed.headers)

            if parsed.data:
                try:
                    json_data = json.loads(parsed.data)
                    build_config["body"]["value"] = json_data
                except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
                    logger.error(f"Error decoding JSON data: {e}")
            else:
                build_config["body"]["value"] = {}
        except Exception as exc:
            logger.error(f"Error parsing cURL: {exc}")
            raise ValueError(f"Error parsing cURL: {exc}")
        return build_config

    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dotdict, field_value: Any, field_name: Optional[str] = None):
        if field_name == "curl" and field_value:
            build_config = self.parse_curl(field_value, build_config)
        return build_config

    def make_request(
        self,
        method: str,
        url: str,
        headers: Optional[dict] = None,
        body: Optional[dict] = None,
        timeout: int = 5,
        auth: Optional[Any] = None,  # Adding auth parameter
    ) -> Data:
        method = method.upper()
        if method not in ["GET", "POST", "PATCH", "PUT", "DELETE"]:
            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported method: {method}")

        try:
            response = requests.request(
                method, url, headers=headers, json=body, timeout=timeout, auth=auth
            )
            try:
                result = response.json()
            except json.JSONDecodeError:
                result = response.text
            return Data(
                data={
                    "source": url,
                    "headers": headers,
                    "status_code": response.status_code,
                    "result": result,
                },
            )
        except requests.exceptions.Timeout:
            return Data(
                data={
                    "source": url,
                    "headers": headers,
                    "status_code": 408,
                    "error": "Request timed out",
                },
            )
        except requests.exceptions.RequestException as exc:
            return Data(
                data={
                    "source": url,
                    "headers": headers,
                    "status_code": 500,
                    "error": str(exc),
                },
            )

    def add_query_params(self, url: str, params: dict) -> str:
        url_parts = list(urlparse(url))
        query = dict(parse_qsl(url_parts[4]))
        query.update(params)
        url_parts[4] = urlencode(query)
        return urlunparse(url_parts)

    def make_requests(self) -> List[Data]:
        method = self.method or "GET"
        urls = [url.strip() for url in self.urls if url.strip()] if self.urls else []
        headers = self.headers.data if isinstance(self.headers, Data) else self.headers or {}
        body = self.body.data if isinstance(self.body, Data) else self.body or {}
        timeout = self.timeout or 5
        query_params = self.query_params.data if isinstance(self.query_params, Data) else {}
        auth = None
        # Handling Authentication
        if self.auth_type == "Bearer" and self.api_key:
            headers["Authorization"] = f"Bearer {self.api_key}"
        elif self.auth_type == "Basic" and self.username and self.password:
            from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth
            auth = HTTPBasicAuth(self.username, self.password)
        else:
            auth = None

        bodies = [body] * len(urls)
        urls = [self.add_query_params(url, query_params) for url in urls]

        if not urls:
            logger.warning("No URLs provided; returning empty result set.")
            return []

        results = [
            self.make_request(method, url, headers, rec, timeout, auth=auth) for url, rec in zip(urls, bodies)
        ]
        self.status = results
        return results

code.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"
    name = "ParseData"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)
code.name: code

template.info: The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.

node.description: Convert Data into plain text following a specified template.

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message
code.name: code

data_template.name: data_template
data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.

input_value.name: input_value
input_value.info: Message to be passed as output.

session_id.name: session_id
session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.

should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.

import json
from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional
from urllib.parse import parse_qsl, urlencode, urlparse, urlunparse

import requests
from loguru import logger
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, DropdownInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, NestedDictInput, Output, SecretStrInput, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.dotdict import dotdict

    description = (

        "You can configure headers, body, and query parameters dynamically and externally, as well as manage "
        "timeouts and choose from various HTTP methods. Additionally, you can parse a cURL command "
        "to auto-fill these fields."
    )
    icon = "Globe"
    name = "RESTAPIConnector"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="urls",
            display_name="URLs",
            is_list=True,
            info="Enter one or more URLs, separated by commas.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="method",
            display_name="HTTP Method",
            options=["GET", "POST", "PUT", "PATCH", "DELETE"],
            value="GET",
            info="Select the HTTP method for the request.",
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="timeout",
            display_name="Timeout (seconds)",
            value=5,
            info="Specify the timeout duration for the request.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="API Key",
            value="None",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="auth_type",
            display_name="Authentication Type",
            options=["None", "Basic", "Bearer"],
            value="None",
            advanced=True,
            info="Choose the type of authentication for the request.",
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="username",
            display_name="Username (for Basic Auth)",
            advanced=True,
            value="",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="password",
            display_name="Password (for Basic Auth)",
            advanced=True,
            value="None",
        ),
        NestedDictInput(
            name="headers",
            display_name="Custom Headers",
            info="Headers to include with the request.",
            input_types=["Data"],
            advanced=True,
        ),
        NestedDictInput(
            name="body",
            display_name="Body Parameters",
            info="Body parameters for POST, PUT, PATCH requests.",
            input_types=["Data"],
            advanced=True,
        ),
        NestedDictInput(
            name="query_params",
            display_name="Query Parameters",
            info="Query parameters to append to the URL.",
            input_types=["Data"],
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MultilineInput(
            name="curl",
            display_name="cURL Command",
            info="Paste a cURL command to auto-fill fields.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Response Data", name="data", method="make_requests"),
    ]

    def parse_curl(self, curl: str, build_config: dotdict) -> dotdict:
        try:
            # Parse cURL command into components
            parsed = parse_context(curl)
            build_config["urls"]["value"] = [parsed.url]

            build_config["headers"]["value"] = dict(parsed.headers)

            if parsed.data:
                try:
                    json_data = json.loads(parsed.data)
                    build_config["body"]["value"] = json_data
                except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
                    logger.error(f"Error decoding JSON data: {e}")
            else:
                build_config["body"]["value"] = {}
        except Exception as exc:
            logger.error(f"Error parsing cURL: {exc}")
            raise ValueError(f"Error parsing cURL: {exc}")
        return build_config

    def update_build_config(self, build_config: dotdict, field_value: Any, field_name: Optional[str] = None):
        if field_name == "curl" and field_value:
            build_config = self.parse_curl(field_value, build_config)
        return build_config

    def make_request(
        self,
        method: str,
        url: str,
        headers: Optional[dict] = None,
        body: Optional[dict] = None,
        timeout: int = 5,
        auth: Optional[Any] = None,  # Adding auth parameter
    ) -> Data:
        method = method.upper()
        if method not in ["GET", "POST", "PATCH", "PUT", "DELETE"]:
            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported method: {method}")

        try:
            response = requests.request(
                method, url, headers=headers, json=body, timeout=timeout, auth=auth
            )
            try:
                result = response.json()
            except json.JSONDecodeError:
                result = response.text
            return Data(
                data={
                    "source": url,
                    "headers": headers,
                    "status_code": response.status_code,
                    "result": result,
                },
            )
        except requests.exceptions.Timeout:
            return Data(
                data={
                    "source": url,
                    "headers": headers,
                    "status_code": 408,
                    "error": "Request timed out",
                },
            )
        except requests.exceptions.RequestException as exc:
            return Data(
                data={
                    "source": url,
                    "headers": headers,
                    "status_code": 500,
                    "error": str(exc),

            )

        url_parts = list(urlparse(url))
        query = dict(parse_qsl(url_parts[4]))
        query.update(params)
        url_parts[4] = urlencode(query)
        return urlunparse(url_parts)

        urls = [url.strip() for url in self.urls if url.strip()] if self.urls else []
        headers = self.headers.data if isinstance(self.headers, Data) else self.headers or {}
        body = self.body.data if isinstance(self.body, Data) else self.body or {}
        timeout = self.timeout or 5
        query_params = self.query_params.data if isinstance(self.query_params, Data) else {}
        auth = None
        # Handling Authentication
        if self.auth_type == "Bearer" and self.api_key:
            headers["Authorization"] = f"Bearer {self.api_key}"
        elif self.auth_type == "Basic" and self.username and self.password:
            from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth
            auth = HTTPBasicAuth(self.username, self.password)
        else:
            auth = None

        bodies = [body] * len(urls)
        urls = [self.add_query_params(url, query_params) for url in urls]

        if not urls:
            logger.warning("No URLs provided; returning empty result set.")
            return []

        results = [
            self.make_request(method, url, headers, rec, timeout, auth=auth) for url, rec in zip(urls, bodies)
        ]
        self.status = results
        return results

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"
    name = "ParseData"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message
